To achieve this, I need to place a red ball strategically. A possible action is to place the red ball directly below the initial position of the light teal circle, but slightly to its left, as imagined in the <IMAGEINE>.

By placing the red ball at that position, when the simulation starts, both the light teal circle and the red ball will fall due to gravity. The red ball, being placed slightly to the left of the light teal circle's direct vertical path, will collide with it. This collision will impart a horizontal force, pushing the light teal circle towards the right. This crucial rightward momentum is necessary because the purple target line is located at the bottom-right of the scene. Without this push, the light teal circle would likely fall straight down along the black line and miss the target.
